definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: The largest group was from Tsinghua University.
sentences.chinese: 其中最大的代表团来自于清华大学。

sentences.english: The Chinese delegation was headed by Vice Premier Wang Qishan.
sentences.chinese: 中国代表团团长是中国副总理王歧山。

sentences.english: I was the only person in the delegation without an official title.
sentences.chinese: 我当时是代表团中唯一没有官衔的人员。

sentences.english: It protects US officials there and guards visiting congressional delegations.
sentences.chinese: 在那里，它保护美国官员和来访的美国国会代表团。

sentences.english: The investment-inviting delegation has attracted many busi-nesspeople from Southeast Asia to Singapore to hold talks on various projects.
sentences.chinese: 招商代表团吸引了很多东南亚客商来新加坡洽商项目。

sentences.english: Our delegation is composed of 1099 people.
sentences.chinese: 我们的中国代表团是有1099人组成的。

sentences.english: The managing director agreed to receive a deputation from the factory.
sentences.chinese: 总经理同意接见工厂派来的代表团。

sentences.english: Before they left, the delegation expressed their satisfaction for this visit and China's arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 离华前，代表团对访问和中方的安排表示满意。

sentences.english: The delayed player delegine stay on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 被耽延的运鼓动代表团停留在操场上。

sentences.english: A Japanese student delegation will come to visit our school on Friday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 星期五下午一个日本学生代表团要来参观我们学校。

sentences.english: They whooped a welcome at the gate when the group of delegations came in.
sentences.chinese: 代表团进入的时候他们在大门口高呼欢迎。

sentences.english: The delegation met with people from all walks of life.
sentences.chinese: 代表团接触了各界人士。

sentences.english: Major League Baseball Commissioner Bud Selig rejected the deal.
sentences.chinese: 职业棒球大联盟代表团成员蓓蕾塞利格拒绝交易。

sentences.english: I would also like to warmly welcome Madam Chang Pijun and her colleagues from the National Library of China.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎常副馆长率领的中国国家图书馆代表团来英交流。

sentences.english: Some members of the delegation had arrived at an earlier date.
sentences.chinese: 代表团的部分成员已先期到达。

sentences.english: After the meeting, the delegation visited the History Museum of HUST.
sentences.chinese: 会后，代表团参观了校史馆。

definition: to go and visit in an official capacity or for investigation
